tools.name: get_agent_info
tools.description: Get detailed information about the current agent configuration, including name, description, instructions, model settings, and the IDs of all skills and tools currently used by the agent.

tools.name: get_agent_feedback
tools.description: Get user feedback for the agent.

filter.description: Filter type: 'active' for non-dismissed feedback only (default), 'all' for all feedback

limit.description: Maximum number of feedback items to return (default: 50)

tools.name: get_agent_insights
tools.description: Get insight and analytics data for the agent, including the number of active users, the conversation and message counts, and the feedback statistics.

days.description: Number of days to include in the analysis (default: 30)

tools.name: get_available_agents
tools.description: Get the list of available agents that can be used as sub-agents. Returns active agents accessible to the current user, excluding global agents.

limit.description: Maximum number of agents to return (default: 100)

tools.name: get_available_knowledge
tools.description: Get the list of available knowledge sources that can be added to an agent. Returns a hierarchical structure organized by spaces, with connected data sources, folders, and websites listed under each space. Only includes sources accessible to the current user.

category.description: Optional category to filter results. Options: 'managed' (connected data sources like Notion, Slack), 'folder' (custom folders), 'website' (crawled websites). If not provided, returns all categories.

spaceId.description: Optional space ID to filter results to a specific space. If not provided, returns knowledge from all accessible spaces.

tools.name: get_available_models
tools.description: Get the list of available models. Can optionally filter by provider.

providerId.description: Optional provider ID to filter models (e.g., 'openai', 'anthropic', 'google_ai_studio', 'mistral')

tools.name: get_available_skills
tools.description: Get the list of available skills that can be added to agents. Returns skills accessible to the current user across all spaces they have access to.

tools.name: get_available_tools
tools.description: Get the list of available tools (MCP servers) that can be added to agents. Returns tools accessible to the current user.

tools.name: list_suggestions
tools.description: List existing suggestions for the agent's configuration changes.

kind.description: Filter by suggestion type. Options: instructions, tools, sub_agent, skills, model. If not provided, returns all types.

limit.description: Maximum number of suggestions to return. Results are ordered by creation date (most recent first). If not provided, returns all matching suggestions.

states.description: Filter by suggestion states. Options: pending, approved, rejected, outdated. If not provided, returns all states.

tools.name: suggest_model
tools.description: Suggest changing the agent's LLM model configuration. IMPORTANT: Include the tool output verbatim in your response - it renders as interactive card.

analysis.description: Analysis or reasoning for the suggestion

tools.name: suggest_prompt_edits
tools.description: Create suggestions to modify the agent's instructions/prompt using block-based targeting. The instructions HTML contains blocks with data-block-id attributes (e.g., 'a3f1b20e'). Each suggestion targets a specific block by its ID and provides the full replacement HTML for that block. Each block ID must appear at most once. For full rewrites, use targetBlockId 'instructions-root'. Word-level diffs will be computed and displayed inline. IMPORTANT: Include the tool output verbatim in your response - it renders as interactive card(s).

suggestions.description: Array of block modifications. Each targets a block by its data-block-id and provides new content. Each suggestion can have its own analysis.

analysis.description: Analysis or reasoning for this specific suggestion

content.description:
The full HTML content for this block, including the tag (e.g., '

New text

' or '

Section Title

')

targetBlockId.description: The data-block-id of the block to modify (e.g., '7f3a2b1c')

type.description: The type of modification to perform on the target block

tools.name: suggest_skills
tools.description: Suggest adding or removing skills from the agent's configuration. If a pending suggestion for the same skill already exists, it will be automatically marked as outdated. IMPORTANT: Include the tool output verbatim in your response - it renders as interactive card.

analysis.description: Analysis or reasoning for the suggestion

suggestion.description: The skill additions and/or deletions to suggest

tools.name: suggest_sub_agent
tools.description: Suggest adding or removing a sub-agent from the agent's configuration. A sub-agent allows the main agent to delegate tasks to a child agent. If a pending suggestion for the same sub-agent already exists, it will be automatically marked as outdated. IMPORTANT: Include the tool output verbatim in your response - it renders as interactive card.

action.description: The action to perform: 'add' to add the sub-agent, 'remove' to remove it

analysis.description: Analysis or reasoning for the suggestion

subAgentId.description: The sId of the agent to add or remove as a sub-agent

tools.name: suggest_tools
tools.description: Suggest adding or removing tools from the agent's configuration. This tool does not support sub_agent suggestions - use `suggest_sub_agent` instead for that purpose. If a pending suggestion for the same tool already exists, it will be automatically marked as outdated. IMPORTANT: Include the tool output verbatim in your response - it renders as interactive card.

analysis.description: Analysis or reasoning for the suggestion

suggestion.description: The tool additions and/or deletions to suggest

tools.name: update_suggestions_state
tools.description: Update the state of one or more suggestions. Use this to reject or mark suggestions as outdated.

suggestions.description: Array of suggestions to update with their new states

state.description: The new state for the suggestion: 'rejected' or 'outdated'.

suggestionId.description: The sId of the suggestion to update

tools.name: create_agent
tools.description: Create a new agent.

description.description: A brief description of what the agent does

emoji.description: An emoji character to use as the agent's avatar (e.g., 'ðŸ¤–'). If not provided, defaults to 'ðŸ¤–'

instructions.description: The prompt/instructions that define the agent's behavior

name.description: The name of the agent (must be unique). Only letters, numbers, underscores (_) and hyphens (-) are allowed. Maximum 30 characters.

sub_agent_description.description: A brief description of what the sub-agent does

sub_agent_emoji.description: An emoji character to use as the sub-agent's avatar (e.g., 'ðŸ¤”'). If not provided, defaults to 'ðŸ¤–'

sub_agent_instructions.description: The prompt/instructions that define the sub-agent's behavior

sub_agent_name.description: The name of the sub-agent to create. If provided, sub_agent_description and sub_agent_instructions must also be provided.

tools.name: compact_memory
tools.description: Compact the memory by removing duplicate entries and summarizing long entries for the current user

edits.description: The array of memory entries to compact/edit.

content.description: The new compacted content for the memory entry.

index.description: The index of the memory entry to overwrite.

tools.name: edit_entries
tools.description: Edit (overwrite) memory entries by indexes for the current user

edits.description: The array of memory entries to edit.

content.description: The new content for the memory entry.

index.description: The index of the memory entry to overwrite.

tools.name: erase_entries
tools.description: Erase memory entries by indexes for the current user

indexes.description: The indexes of the memory entries to erase.

tools.name: record_entries
tools.description: Record new memory entries for the current user

entries.description: The array of new memory entries to record.

tools.name: retrieve
tools.description: Retrieve all agent memories for the current user

tools.name: list_all_published_agents
tools.description: Returns a complete list of all published agents in the workspace. Each agent includes its name, description, and mention directive (e.g., `:mention[agent-name]{sId=xyz}`) to display a clickable link to the agent.

tools.name: suggest_agents_for_content
tools.description: Analyzes a user query and returns relevant specialized agents that might be better suited to handling specific requests. The tool uses semantic matching to find agents whose capabilities align with the query content. Each suggested agent includes its mention directive (e.g., `:mention[agent-name]{sId=xyz}`) to display a clickable link, along with its description and instructions.

tools.name: create_candidate_note
tools.description: Create a note on a candidate's profile in Ashby. The note content can include basic HTML formatting (supported tags: h1-h6, p, b, i, u, a, ul, ol, li, code, pre).

email.description: Email address to search for (partial matches supported).

name.description: Name to search for (partial matches supported).

noteContent.description: The content of the note in HTML format.

tools.name: get_candidate_notes
tools.description: Retrieve all notes for a candidate. This tool will search for the candidate by name or email and return all notes on their profile.

email.description: Email address to search for (partial matches supported).

name.description: Name to search for (partial matches supported).

tools.name: get_interview_feedback
tools.description: Retrieve interview feedback for a candidate. This tool will search for the candidate by name or email and return all submitted interview feedback for the most recent application.

email.description: Email address to search for (partial matches supported).

name.description: Name to search for (partial matches supported).

tools.name: get_report_data
tools.description: Retrieve report data and save it as a CSV file.

reportUrl.description: Full URL of the Ashby report (e.g., https://app.ashbyhq.com/reports/saved/[reportId]).

tools.name: search_candidates
tools.description: Search for candidates by name and/or email. Returns up to 20 matching candidates by default.

email.description: Email address to search for (partial matches supported).

name.description: Name to search for (partial matches supported).

tools.name: generate_random_float
tools.description: Generate a random floating point number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).

tools.name: generate_random_number
tools.description: Generate a random positive number between 1 and the provided maximum (inclusive).

max.description: Upper bound for the generated integer. Defaults to 1000000.

tools.name: get_current_time
tools.description: Return the current date and time in multiple convenient formats.

items.description: Specify which formats to return. Defaults to all.

tools.name: get_mention_markdown
tools.description: Get the markdown directive to use to mention a user in a message.

mention.description: A mention to get the markdown directive for.

tools.name: math_operation
tools.description: Perform mathematical operations.

tools.name: search_available_users
tools.description: Search for users that are available to the conversation.

searchTerm.description: A single search term to find users. Returns all the users that contain the search term in their name or description. Use an empty string to return all items.

tools.name: wait
tools.description: Pause execution for the provided number of milliseconds (maximum 180000).

duration_ms.description: The time to wait in milliseconds, up to 3 minutes.

tools.name: create_page
tools.description: Create a new Confluence page in a specified space with optional content and parent page.

body.description: Page body content

representation.description: Content format: 'storage' for Confluence storage format, 'atlas_doc_format' for ADF

value.description: Page content in the specified format

parentId.description: Parent page ID to create this page as a child

spaceId.description: The ID of the space where the page will be created

title.description: The title of the new page

tools.name: get_current_user
tools.description: Get information about the currently authenticated Confluence user including account ID, display name, and email.

tools.name: get_page
tools.description: Get a single Confluence page by its ID. Returns the page metadata and optionally the page body content.

includeBody.description: Whether to include the page body content (default: false). When true, returns body in storage format.

pageId.description: The ID of the page to retrieve

tools.name: get_pages
tools.description: Search for Confluence pages using CQL (Confluence Query Language). Only returns page objects. Supports flexible text matching: use '~' for contains (title~"meeting"), '!~' for not contains, or '=' for exact match. Examples: 'type=page AND space=DEV', 'type=page AND title~"meeting notes"', 'type=page AND text~"quarterly"', 'type=page AND creator=currentUser()'

cql.description: CQL query string. Must include 'type=page' to filter for pages only.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor from previous response for next page

limit.description: Number of results per page (default 25)

tools.name: get_spaces
tools.description: Get a list of Confluence spaces. Returns a list of spaces with their IDs, keys, names, types, and statuses.

tools.name: update_page
tools.description: Update an existing Confluence page. You can update the title, content, status, space, or parent. The version number must be incremented from the current version.

body.description: Page body content to update

representation.description: Content format: 'storage' for Confluence storage format, 'atlas_doc_format' for ADF

value.description: Page content in the specified format

parentId.description: New parent page ID to move the page under

spaceId.description: New space ID to move the page to

version.description: Version information - increment the number from current version

message.description: Optional version comment explaining the changes

tools.name: cat_conversation_file
tools.description: Read the contents of a large file from conversation attachments with offset/limit and optional grep filtering (named after the 'cat' unix tool). Use this when files are too large to read in full, or when you need to search for specific patterns within a file.

fileId.description: The fileId of the attachment to read, as returned by the conversation_list_files action

grep.description: A regular expression to filter lines. Applied after offset/limit slicing. Only lines matching this pattern will be returned.

limit.description: The maximum number of characters to read. If not provided, reads all characters.

offset.description: The character position to start reading from (0-based). If not provided, starts from the beginning.

tools.name: list_files
tools.description: List all files attached to the conversation.

tools.name: cat
tools.description: Read the contents of a document, referred to by its nodeId (named after the 'cat' unix tool). The nodeId can be obtained using the 'find', 'list' or 'search' tools.

grep.description: A regular expression to filter lines. Applied after offset/limit slicing. Only lines matching this pattern will be returned.

limit.description: The maximum number of characters to read. If not provided, reads all characters.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to read. This is not the human-readable node title.

offset.description: The character position to start reading from (0-based). If not provided, starts from the beginning.

tools.name: find
tools.description: Find content based on their title starting from a specific node. Can be used to find specific nodes by searching for their titles. The query title can be omitted to list all nodes starting from a specific node. This is like using 'find' in Unix.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Initial searches should use 10-20.

mimeTypes.description: The mime types to search for. If provided, only nodes with one of these mime types will be returned. If not provided, no filter will be applied. The mime types passed here must be one of the mime types found in the 'mimeType' field.

nextPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results. This parameter should only be used to fetch the next page of a previous search. The value should be exactly the 'nextPageCursor' from the previous search result.

query.description: The title to search for. This supports partial matching and does not require the exact title. For example, searching for 'budget' will find 'Budget 2024.xlsx', 'Q1 Budget Report', etc...

rootNodeId.description: The node ID of the node to start the search from. If not provided, the search will start from the root of the filesystem. This ID can be found from previous search results in the 'nodeId' field. This parameter restricts the search to the children and descendant of a specific node. If a node output by this tool or the list toolhas children (hasChildren: true), it means that it can be passed as a rootNodeId.

tools.name: list
tools.description: List the direct contents of a node, like 'ls' in Unix. Should only be used on nodes with children (hasChildren: true). A good fit is to explore the filesystem structure step by step. This tool can be called repeatedly by passing the 'nodeId' output from a step to the next step's nodeId. If a node output by this tool or the find tool has children (hasChildren: true), it means that this tool can be used again on it.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Initial searches should use 10-20.

mimeTypes.description: The mime types to search for. If provided, only nodes with one of these mime types will be returned. If not provided, no filter will be applied. The mime types passed here must be one of the mime types found in the 'mimeType' field.

nextPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results. This parameter should only be used to fetch the next page of a previous search. The value should be exactly the 'nextPageCursor' from the previous search result.

nodeId.description: The exact ID of the node to list the contents of. This ID can be found from previous search results in the 'nodeId' field. If not provided, the content at the root of the filesystem will be shown.

sortBy.description: Field to sort the results by. 'title' sorts alphabetically A-Z, 'timestamp' sorts by most recent first. If not specified, results are returned in the default order, which is folders first, then both documents and tables and alphabetically by title.

tools.name: locate_in_tree
tools.description: Show the complete path from a node to the data source root, displaying the hierarchy of parent nodes. This is useful for understanding where a specific node is located within the data source structure. The path is returned as a list of nodes, with the first node being the data source root and the last node being the target node.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to locate in the tree.

tools.name: semantic_search
tools.description: Perform a semantic search within the folders and files designated by `nodeIds`. All children of the designated nodes will be searched.

nodeIds.description: Array of exact content node IDs to search within. These are the 'nodeId' values from previous search results. All children of the designated nodes will be searched. If not provided, all available nodes will be searched.

query.description: The string used to retrieve relevant chunks of information using semantic similarity based on the user request and conversation context. Include as much semantic signal based on the entire conversation history, paraphrasing if necessary. longer queries are generally better.

relativeTimeFrame.description: The time frame (relative to LOCAL_TIME) to restrict the search based on the user request and past conversation context. Possible values are: `all`, `{k}h`, `{k}d`, `{k}w`, `{k}m`, `{k}y` where {k} is a number. Be strict, do not invent invalid values.

tools.name: describe_tables
tools.description: Get detailed schema information for one or more tables. Provides DBML schema definitions, SQL dialect-specific query guidelines, and example rows. All tables must be from the same warehouse - cross-warehouse schema requests are not supported. Use this to understand table structure before writing queries.

tableIds.description: Array of table identifiers in the format 'table-<dataSourceId>-<nodeId>'. All tables must be from the same warehouse (same dataSourceId).

tools.name: find
tools.description: Find tables, schemas and databases based on their name starting from a specific node in the tables hierarchy. Can be used to search for tables by name across warehouses, databases, and schemas. The query supports partial matching - for example, searching for 'sales' will find 'sales_2024', 'monthly_sales_report', etc. This is like using 'find' in Unix for tables.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 50, max is 100.

nextPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results. Use the 'nextPageCursor' from the previous find result to fetch additional items.

query.description: The table name to search for. This supports partial matching and does not require the exact name. For example, searching for 'revenue' will find 'revenue_2024', 'monthly_revenue', 'revenue_by_region', etc. If omitted, lists all tables.

rootNodeId.description: The node ID to start the search from (warehouse, database, or schema ID). If not provided, searches across all available warehouses. This restricts the search to the specified node and all its descendants.

tools.name: list
tools.description: List the direct contents of a warehouse, database, or schema. Can be used to see what is inside a specific location in the tables hierarchy, like 'ls' in Unix. If no nodeId is provided, lists all available data warehouses at the root level. Hierarchy supports: warehouse â†’ database â†’ schema â†’ nested schemas â†’ tables. Schemas can be arbitrarily nested within other schemas. Results are paginated with a default limit and you can fetch additional pages using the nextPageCursor.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 50, max is 100.

nextPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results. Use the 'nextPageCursor' from the previous list result to fetch additional items.

nodeId.description: The ID of the warehouse, database, or schema to list contents of. If not provided, lists all available data warehouses at the root.

tools.name: query
tools.description: Execute SQL queries on tables from the same warehouse. You MUST call describe_tables at least once before attempting to query tables to understand their structure. The query must respect the SQL dialect and guidelines provided by describe_tables. All tables in a single query must be from the same warehouse.

fileName.description: The name of the file to save the results to.

query.description: The SQL query to execute. Must respect the SQL dialect and guidelines provided by describe_tables.

tableIds.description: Array of table identifiers in the format 'table-<dataSourceId>-<nodeId>'. All tables must be from the same warehouse (same dataSourceId).

tools.name: list_warehouses
tools.description: List all SQL warehouses available in the Databricks workspace.

tools.name: extract_information_from_documents
tools.description: Extract structured information from documents in reverse chronological order, according to the needs described by the objective and specified by a JSON schema. This tool retrieves content from data sources already pre-configured by the user, ensuring the latest information is included.

objective.description: The objective behind the use of the tool based on the conversation state. This is used to guide the tool to extract the right data based on the user request.

timeFrame.description: The time frame to use for documents retrieval (e.g. last 7 days, last 2 months). Leave null to search all documents regardless of time.

tools.name: convert_file_format
tools.description: Converts a file from one format to another.

file_id_or_url.description: The ID or URL of the file to convert. You can either provide the ID of a file in the conversation (note: if the file ID is already in the desired format, no conversion is needed) or the URL to a file.

file_name.description: The name of the file to generate. Must be a valid filename without the format extension.

output_format.description: The format of the output file.

source_format.description: The format of the source file. Use the `get_source_format_to_convert_to` tool to get the list of formats you can use.

tools.name: generate_file
tools.description: Generate a file with some content.

file_content.description: The content of the file to generate. You can either provide the id of a file in the conversation (note: if the file ID is already in the desired format, no conversion is needed), the url to a file or the content directly.

file_name.description: The name of the file to generate. Must be a valid filename with the format extension.

source_format.description: The format of the input content. Use 'markdown' for markdown-formatted text, 'html' for HTML content, or 'text' for plain text (default).

tools.name: get_supported_source_formats_for_output_format
tools.description: Get a list of source formats supported for a target output format.

tools.name: add_ticket_note
tools.description: Adds a note to an existing ticket

body.description: Content of the note in HTML format

tools.name: add_ticket_reply
tools.description: Adds a reply to a ticket conversation

body.description: Content of the note in HTML format

tools.name: create_solution_article
tools.description: Creates a new solution article in a specific folder. To get folder_id: 1) Use list_solution_categories to get category IDs, 2) Use list_solution_folders with category_id to get folder IDs, 3) Use the folder_id here.

folder_id.description: Folder ID to place the article in (required) - use list_solution_folders to get available folder IDs

tools.name: create_ticket
tools.description: Creates a new ticket in Freshservice. You MUST call get_ticket_write_fields first to get required fields, then provide all required field values in the custom_fields parameter.

tools.name: create_ticket_task
tools.description: Creates a new task on a ticket. Tasks help break down complex tickets into manageable subtasks.

agent_id.description: Agent ID to assign the task to

group_id.description: Group ID to assign the task to

notify_before.description: Number of hours before due date to send notification

tools.name: delete_ticket_task
tools.description: Deletes a task from a ticket

task_id.description: The ID of the task to delete

tools.name: get_canned_response
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific canned response

response_id.description: The ID of the canned response

tools.name: get_requester
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific requester

tools.name: get_service_item
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific service catalog item including fields and pricing

display_id.description: The display ID of the service catalog item

tools.name: get_service_item_fields
tools.description: Gets the field configuration for a service catalog item. You must call this before request_service_item to get required fields. Returns required_fields and hidden_required_fields that must be provided.

display_id.description: The display ID of the service catalog item

tools.name: get_solution_article
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific solution article including its full content

article_id.description: The ID of the solution article

tools.name: get_ticket
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific ticket. By default returns essential fields for performance, but you can specify specific fields.

fields.description: Optional list of fields to include. Defaults to essential fields (id, subject, description_text, priority, status, requester_id, responder_id, department_id, group_id, type, created_at, updated_at, due_by) for performance.

include.description: Additional information to include (e.g., conversations, requester, stats, problem, assets, changes, related_tickets, onboarding_context, offboarding_context).

tools.name: get_ticket_approval
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific ticket approval

approval_id.description: The ID of the approval to retrieve

tools.name: get_ticket_read_fields
tools.description: Lists available Freshservice ticket field ids for use in the get_ticket.fields parameter (read-time).

tools.name: get_ticket_task
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific task on a ticket

tools.name: get_ticket_write_fields
tools.description: Lists all available ticket fields including standard and custom fields. Use this to discover what fields are available for use in create_ticket, update_ticket, and other operations.

search.description: Search term to filter fields by name or label

tools.name: list_canned_responses
tools.description: Lists all canned responses available in Freshservice

search.description: Search term to filter canned responses by name or content

tools.name: list_departments
tools.description: Lists all departments in Freshservice

tools.name: list_oncall_schedules
tools.description: Lists on-call schedules

tools.name: list_products
tools.description: Lists all products in Freshservice

tools.name: list_purchase_orders
tools.description: Lists purchase orders

tools.name: list_requesters
tools.description: Lists requesters

tools.name: list_service_categories
tools.description: Lists service catalog categories. Use this first to get category IDs for filtering service items.

tools.name: list_service_items
tools.description: Lists service catalog items. To filter by category: 1) Use list_service_categories to get category IDs, 2) Use the category_id parameter here.

category_id.description: Filter by category ID - use list_service_categories to get available category IDs

tools.name: list_sla_policies
tools.description: Lists SLA policies

tools.name: list_solution_articles
tools.description: Lists solution articles within a specific folder (returns metadata only, use get_solution_article for full content). To get folder_id: 1) Use list_solution_categories to get category IDs, 2) Use list_solution_folders with category_id to get folder IDs, 3) Use the folder_id here.

category_id.description: Filter by category ID (optional additional filter)

folder_id.description: Folder ID (required) - use list_solution_folders to get available folder IDs

tools.name: list_solution_categories
tools.description: Lists solution categories. These are used to organize solution folders, which are mandatory for ticket listing.

tools.name: list_solution_folders
tools.description: Lists solution folders within categories. Solution folders are mandatory for ticket listing. Use list_solution_categories first to get category IDs, then filter folders by category_id.

tools.name: list_ticket_approvals
tools.description: Lists all approvals for a specific ticket

tools.name: list_ticket_tasks
tools.description: Lists all tasks associated with a ticket

tools.name: list_tickets
tools.description: Lists tickets with optional filtering and pagination. By default returns minimal fields (id, subject, status) for performance.

fields.description: Optional list of fields to include. Defaults to essential fields for performance.

updated_since.description: ISO 8601 date-time string to filter tickets updated since this time

tools.name: request_service_approval
tools.description: Requests approval for a ticket. This creates an approval request that needs to be approved before the ticket can be fulfilled. Only works on tickets that have approval workflow configured.

approval_type.description: Approval type: 1=Everyone must approve, 2=Anyone can approve

approver_id.description: The ID of the user who should approve this request

email_content.description: Custom email content for approval notification. If not provided, default notification will be sent.

tools.name: request_service_item
tools.description: Creates a service request for a catalog item. This creates a new ticket. You MUST call get_service_item_fields first to get required fields, then provide all required field values in the fields parameter.

display_id.description: The display ID of the service catalog item to request

fields.description: Custom field values for the service request form

requested_for.description: Email of the person this is requested for (if different from requester)

ticket_id.description: Optional ticket ID to attach this service request to

tools.name: search_service_items
tools.description: Searches for service items from the service catalog for a given search term. Only use this when specifically searching for items by keyword.

search_term.description: The keywords for which the service items have to be searched (e.g. 'VPN issue', 'Adobe')

user_email.description: By default, the API will search items for the user whose API key is provided. If you want to search items for a different user, provide their user_email.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Search for files in Google Drive. Can search in personal drive, all shared drives, or a specific drive.

driveId.description: ID of a specific shared drive to search in. If set, only searches that drive.

includeSharedDrives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results. Defaults to true.

orderBy.description:
A comma-separated list of sort key. Valid keys are:
`createdTime`: When the file was created.
`folder`: The folder ID. This field is sorted using alphabetical ordering.
`modifiedByMeTime`: The last time the file was modified by the user.
`modifiedTime`: The last time the file was modified by anyone.
`name`: The name of the file. This field is sorted using alphabetical ordering, so 1, 12, 2, 22.
`name_natural`: The name of the file. This field is sorted using natural sort ordering, so 1, 2, 12, 22.
`quotaBytesUsed`: The number of storage quota bytes used by the file.
`recency`: The most recent timestamp from the file's date-time fields.
`sharedWithMeTime`: When the file was shared with the user, if applicable.
`starred`: Whether the user has starred the file.
`viewedByMeTime`: The last time the file was viewed by the user.
Each key sorts ascending by default, but can be reversed with desc modified. Example: `folder,modifiedTime desc,name`

pageSize.description: Maximum number of files to return (max 1000).

q.description:
Search query to filter files. Uses Google Drive's search syntax. Leave empty to list all supported files. Examples:
- Files with the name "hello": name = 'hello'
- Files with a name containing the words "hello" and "goodbye": name contains 'hello' and name contains 'goodbye'
- Files with a name that does not contain the word "hello": not name contains 'hello'
- Files that contain the text "important" and in the trash: fullText contains 'important' and trashed = true
- Files that contain the word "hello": fullText contains 'hello'
- Files that don't have the word "hello": not fullText contains 'hello'
- Files that contain the exact phrase "hello world": fullText contains '"hello world"'
- Files with a query that contains the "\" character (for example, "\authors"): fullText contains '\\authors'
- Files that are folders: mimeType = 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'
- Files that are not folders: mimeType != 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'
- Files modified after a given date (default time zone is UTC)	modifiedTime > '2012-06-04T12:00:00'
- Image or video files modified after a specific date: modifiedTime > '2012-06-04T12:00:00' and (mimeType contains 'image/' or mimeType contains 'video/')
- Files that are starred: starred = true
- Files within a collection (for example, the folder ID in the parents collection): '1234567' in parents
- Files in an application data folder in a collection: 'appDataFolder' in parents
- Files for which user "test@example.org" is the owner: 'test@example.org' in owners
- Files for which user "test@example.org" has write permission: 'test@example.org' in writers
- Files for which members of the group "group@example.org" have write permission: 'group@example.org' in writers
- Files shared with the authorized user with "hello" in the name: sharedWithMe and name contains 'hello'
- Files with a custom file property visible to all apps: properties has { key='mass' and value='1.3kg' }
- Files with a custom file property private to the requesting app: appProperties has { key='additionalID' and value='8e8aceg2af2ge72e78' }
- Files that have not been shared with anyone or domains (only private, or shared with specific users or groups): visibility = 'limited'

tools.name: get_hubspot_link
tools.description: Purpose: Generates HubSpot UI links for different pages based on object types and IDs. Supports both index pages (lists of objects) and record pages (specific object details). Prerequisites: Use the hubspot-get-portal-id tool to get the PortalId and UiDomain. Usage Guidance: Use to generate links to HubSpot UI pages when users need to reference specific HubSpot records. Validates that object type IDs exist in the HubSpot system.

tools.name: get_hubspot_portal_id
tools.description: Gets the current user's portal ID. To use before calling get_hubspot_link

tools.name: get_latest_objects
tools.description: Get latest objects from Hubspot. Supports contacts, companies, deals. Limit is 200.

tools.name: get_meeting
tools.description: Retrieves a Hubspot meeting (engagement) by its ID.

meetingId.description: The ID of the meeting (engagement) to retrieve.

tools.name: get_object_by_email
tools.description: Retrieves a Hubspot object using an email address. Supports contacts, companies, deals, owners.

email.description: The email address of the object.

tools.name: get_object_properties
tools.description: Lists all available properties for a Hubspot object. When creatableOnly is true, returns only properties that can be modified through forms (excludes hidden, calculated, read-only and file upload fields).

tools.name: get_user_activity
tools.description: Comprehensively retrieves user activity across ALL HubSpot engagement types (tasks, notes, meetings, calls, emails) for any time period. Solves the problem of getting complete user activity data by automatically trying multiple owner property variations and gracefully handling object types that don't support owner filtering. Perfect for queries like 'show my activity for the last week' or 'what did I do this month'. Returns both detailed activity list and summary statistics by activity type. For your own activity: first call get_current_user_id to get your ownerId.

endDate.description: End date for the activity period. Accepts ISO date strings (e.g., '2024-01-08') or timestamps. For current time, use new Date().toISOString().

limit.description: Maximum number of activities to return across all engagement types (default: 200)

ownerId.description: The HubSpot owner/user ID to get activity for. Get your own ID with get_current_user_id, or use another user's ID from list_owners.

startDate.description: Start date for the activity period. Accepts ISO date strings (e.g., '2024-01-01') or timestamps. For 'last week', calculate 7 days ago.

tools.name: list_associations
tools.description: Lists all associations for a given HubSpot object (e.g., list all contacts associated with a company).

toObjectType.description: Optional: specific object type to filter associations

tools.name: list_owners
tools.description: Lists all owners (users) in the HubSpot account with their IDs, names, and email addresses. Use this to find owner IDs for get_user_activity calls when you want to get activity for other users. For your own activity, use get_current_user_id instead.

tools.name: remove_association
tools.description: Removes an association between two HubSpot objects.

fromObjectId.description: The ID of the source object

fromObjectType.description: The type of the source object

toObjectId.description: The ID of the target object

toObjectType.description: The type of the target object

tools.name: search_crm_objects
tools.description: Comprehensive search tool for ALL HubSpot object types including contacts, companies, deals, and ALL engagement types (tasks, notes, meetings, calls, emails). Supports advanced filtering by properties, date ranges, owners, and free-text queries. Enhanced to support owner filtering across all engagement types. IMPORTANT: For enumeration properties (like industry), always use get_object_properties first to discover the exact values. Use this for specific searches, or use get_user_activity for comprehensive user activity across all types.

operator.description: The operator to use for comparison.

propertyName.description: The name of the property to search by.

values.description: The values to compare against. Required for IN/NOT_IN operators.

query.description: Free-text query string.

tools.name: search_owners
tools.description: Searches for specific owners (users) in the HubSpot account by email, name, ID, or user ID. Supports partial matching for names and emails, and exact matching for IDs. Use this to find owner information when you have partial details about a user.

searchQuery.description: The search query - can be email, first name, last name, full name, owner ID, or user ID

tools.name: update_company
tools.description: Updates properties of a HubSpot company by ID.

companyId.description: The ID of the company to update.

properties.description: An object containing the properties to update with their new values.

tools.name: update_contact
tools.description: Updates properties of a HubSpot contact by ID.

contactId.description: The ID of the contact to update.

properties.description: An object containing the properties to update with their new values.

tools.name: update_deal
tools.description: Updates properties of a HubSpot deal by ID.

dealId.description: The ID of the deal to update.

properties.description: An object containing the properties to update with their new values.

tools.name: generate_image
tools.description: Generate or edit images from text descriptions and reference images.

aspectRatio.description: The aspect ratio of the generated image. Must be one of 1:1, 3:2, 2:3, 3:4, 4:3, 4:5, 5:4, 9:16, 16:9, or 21:9.

outputName.description: The filename that will be used to save the generated image. Must be 64 characters or less.

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image.

quality.description: Output resolution: low (1K/1024px), medium (2K/2048px), or high (4K/4096px).

referenceImages.description: Optional file IDs of reference images from conversation attachments. Up to 14 reference images.

tools.name: retrieve_recent_documents
tools.description: Fetch the most recent documents in reverse chronological order up to a pre-allocated size. This tool retrieves content that is already pre-configured by the user, ensuring the latest information is included.

timeFrame.description: An optional time frame to use for the tool.

tools.name: create_interactive_content_file
tools.description: Create a new Interactive Content file that users can execute or interact with. Use this for content that provides functionality beyond static viewing. Validation (Tailwind, TypeScript) is non-blocking: the file is saved even with warnings, which you should fix immediately using targeted edits. Supports two creation modes: template-based (fetch content from existing node) or inline (provide content directly).

description.description: Optional description of what this Interactive Content file does (e.g., 'Interactive data visualization', 'Executable analysis script', 'Dynamic dashboard')

file_name.description: The name of the Interactive Content file to create, including extension (e.g. DataVisualization.tsx)

mime_type.description: The MIME type for the Interactive Content file. Use 'application/vnd.dust.frame' for Frame components (React/JSX).

mode.description: Creation mode: 'template' to reference an existing content node from knowledge (content fetched server-side), or 'inline' to provide content directly.

source.description: When mode='template': the ID of an existing content node to use as a template (e.g., 'template_node_id'). The node's content will be fetched server-side without consuming tokens. When mode='inline': the actual content for the Interactive Content file. Should be complete and ready for execution or interaction.

tools.name: edit_interactive_content_file
tools.description: Modifies content within an Interactive Content file by substituting specified text segments. Each edit creates a new version of the Interactive Content file. Performs single substitution by default, or multiple substitutions when `expected_replacements` is defined. This function demands comprehensive contextual information surrounding the target modification to ensure accurate targeting. Use the retrieve_interactive_content_file tool to review the file's existing content prior to executing any text substitution. Requirements: 1. `old_string` MUST contain the precise literal content for substitution (preserving all spacing, formatting, line breaks). 2. `new_string` MUST contain the exact replacement content maintaining proper syntax. 3. Include minimum 3 lines of surrounding context BEFORE and AFTER the target content for unique identification. **Critical:** Multiple matches or inexact matches will cause failure. Validation (Tailwind, TypeScript) is non-blocking: warnings are returned but the edit succeeds.

expected_replacements.description: Optional number of expected replacements. Defaults to 1. Use when you want to replace multiple identical instances of the same text.

file_id.description: The ID of the Interactive Content file to update (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

new_string.description: The exact text to replace old_string with. Should maintain proper syntax and follow best practices for the file type.

old_string.description: The exact text to find and replace. Must match the file content exactly, including all spacing, formatting, and line breaks. Include surrounding context to ensure unique identification of the target text.

tools.name: get_interactive_content_file_share_url
tools.description: Get the share URL for an Interactive Content file. Returns the share URL if the file is currently shared.

file_id.description: The ID of the Interactive Content file to get share URL for (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

tools.name: rename_interactive_content_file
tools.description: Rename an Interactive Content file. Use this to change the file name while keeping the content unchanged.

file_id.description: The ID of the Interactive Content file to rename (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

new_file_name.description: The new name for the file, including extension (e.g., 'UpdatedChart.tsx')

tools.name: retrieve_interactive_content_file
tools.description: Retrieve the current content of an existing Interactive Content file by its file ID. Use this to read back the content of Interactive Content files you have previously created or updated. Use this tool before calling edit_interactive_content_file to understand the current file state and identify the exact text to replace.

file_id.description: The ID of the Interactive Content file to retrieve (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

tools.name: revert_interactive_content_file
tools.description: Resets an Interactive Content file to its previous version. Each revert goes back one version in the file's history.

file_id.description: The ID of the Interactive Content file to revert (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

tools.name: create_comment
tools.description: Adds a comment to an existing JIRA issue. Accepts either plain text string or rich Atlassian Document Format (ADF).

comment.description: The comment content - either plain text string or ADF document object for rich formatting

visibilityValue.description: Group or role name for visibility restriction

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Creates a new JIRA issue with the specified details. For textarea fields (like description), you can use either plain text or rich ADF format. Note: Available fields vary by project and issue type. Use get_issue_create_fields to check which fields are required and available.

tools.name: create_issue_link
tools.description: Creates a link between two JIRA issues with a specified relationship type (e.g., 'Blocks', 'Relates', 'Duplicates').

linkData.description: Link configuration including type and issues to link

comment.description: Optional comment when creating the link

key.description: Issue key that will be on the 'inward' side of the link
Issue key that will be on the 'outward' side of the link

name.description: Link type name (e.g., 'Blocks', 'Relates', 'Duplicates')

tools.name: delete_issue_link
tools.description: Deletes an existing link between JIRA issues.

linkId.description: The ID of the issue link to delete

tools.name: get_attachments
tools.description: Retrieve all attachments for a Jira issue, including metadata like filename, size, MIME type, and download URLs.

tools.name: get_connection_info
tools.description: Gets comprehensive connection information including user details, cloud ID, and site URL for the currently authenticated JIRA instance. This tool is used when the user is referring about themselves

tools.name: get_issue
tools.description: Retrieves a single JIRA issue by its key (e.g., 'PROJ-123').

fields.description: Optional list of fields to include. Defaults to a minimal set for performance.

tools.name: get_issue_create_fields
tools.description: Create/update-time field metadata for a specific project and issue type. Returns only fields available on the Create/Update screens (subset). Use get_issue_types to get the issue type ID.

issueTypeId.description: The issue type ID to get fields for (required)

tools.name: get_issue_link_types
tools.description: Retrieves all available issue link types that can be used when creating issue links.

tools.name: get_issue_read_fields
tools.description: Lists available Jira field keys/ids and names for use in the get_issue.fields parameter (read-time).

tools.name: get_issue_types
tools.description: Retrieves available issue types for a JIRA project.

tools.name: get_issues
tools.description: Search issues using one or more filters (e.g., status, priority, labels, assignee, fixVersion, customField, dueDate, created, resolved). Use exact matching by default, or fuzzy matching for approximate/partial matches on summary field. For custom fields, use field 'customField' with customFieldName parameter. For date fields (dueDate, created, resolved), use operator parameter with '<', '>', '=', etc. and date format '2023-07-03' or relative '-25d', '7d', '2w', '1M', etc. Results can be sorted using the sortBy parameter with field and direction (ASC/DESC). When referring to the user, use the get_connection_info tool. When referring to unknown create/update fields, use get_issue_create_fields or get_issue_types to discover the field names.

filters.description: Array of search filters to apply (all must match)

customFieldName.description: The name of the custom field to search (e.g., 'Story Points', 'Epic Link').

fuzzy.description: Use fuzzy search (~) for partial/similar matches instead of exact match (=). Only supported for 'summary' field. Use fuzzy when: searching for partial text, handling typos, finding related terms. Use exact when: looking for specific titles, precise matching needed.

operator.description: Operator for comparison. Supported operators: =, <, >, <=, >=, !=. Only supported for date fields like 'dueDate', 'created', 'resolved'. For dates, use format '2023-07-03' or relative format like '-25d', '7d', '2w', '1M', etc.

field.description: The field to filter by. Must be one of: assignee, created, creator, dueDate, fixVersion, issueType, labels, priority, parentIssueKey, project, reporter, resolved, status, summary, updated, votes, watchers.

nextPageToken.description: Token for next page of results (for pagination)

direction.description: Sort direction. Must be one of: ASC, DESC.

field.description: The field to sort by. Must be one of: assignee, created, creator, dueDate, fixVersion, issueType, labels, priority, parentIssueKey, project, reporter, resolved, status, summary, updated, votes, watchers, customField.

tools.name: get_issues_using_jql
tools.description: Search JIRA issues using a custom JQL (Jira Query Language) query. This tool allows for advanced search capabilities beyond the filtered search. Examples: 'project = PROJ AND status = Open', 'assignee = currentUser() AND priority = High', 'created >= -30d AND labels = bug'.

fields.description: Optional list of fields to include in the response. Defaults to ['summary']

jql.description: The JQL (Jira Query Language) query string

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 50, max: 100)

nextPageToken.description: Token for next page of results (for pagination)

tools.name: get_project
tools.description: Retrieves a single JIRA project by its key (e.g., 'PROJ').

tools.name: get_project_versions
tools.description: Retrieves all versions (releases) for a JIRA project. Useful for getting release reports and understanding which versions are available for filtering issues.

tools.name: get_projects
tools.description: Retrieves a list of JIRA projects.

tools.name: get_transitions
tools.description: Gets available transitions for a JIRA issue based on its current status and workflow.

tools.name: get_users
tools.description: Search for JIRA users. Provide emailAddress for exact email match, or name for display name contains. If neither is provided, returns the first maxResults users. Use startAt for pagination (pass the previous result's nextStartAt).

emailAddress.description: Exact email address (e.g., 'john.doe@company.com'). If provided, only exact matches are returned.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of users to return when searching by name (default: 200, max: 200)

name.description: Display name filter (e.g., 'John Doe'). Case-insensitive contains match.

startAt.description: Pagination offset. Pass the previous response's nextStartAt to fetch the next page.

tools.name: read_attachment
tools.description: Read content from any attachment on a Jira issue. For text-based files (PDF, Word, Excel, CSV, plain text), extracts and returns the text content. For other files (images, documents), returns the file for upload. Supports text extraction with OCR for scanned documents.

attachmentId.description: The ID of the attachment to read

tools.name: transition_issue
tools.description: Transitions a JIRA issue to a different status/workflow state.

transitionId.description: The ID of the transition to perform

tools.name: update_issue
tools.description: Updates an existing JIRA issue with new field values (e.g., summary, description, priority, assignee). For textarea fields (like description), you can use either plain text or rich ADF format. Use get_issue_create_fields to identify textarea fields. Note: Issue links, attachments, and some system fields require separate APIs and are not supported.

updateData.description: The partial data to update the issue with - description field supports both plain text and ADF format

tools.name: upload_attachment
tools.description: Upload a file attachment to a Jira issue. Supports two types of file sources: conversation files (from current Dust conversation) and external files (base64 encoded). The attachment must specify its type and corresponding fields. IMPORTANT: The 'type' field must be exactly 'conversation_file' or 'external_file', not a MIME type like 'image/png'.

fileId.description: The fileId from conversation attachments (use conversation_list_files to get available files)

type.description: Use this for files already in the Dust conversation
Use this for new files provided as base64 data

tools.name: jit_all_optionals_and_defaults
tools.description: A single tool aggregating optional/default configs for TIME_FRAME, JSON_SCHEMA, DATA_SOURCE, and AGENT for JIT testing.

tools.name: copy_file
tools.description: Copy a file or folder to a new location in OneDrive or SharePoint.

driveId.description: ID of the drive containing the file (takes priority over siteId)

itemId.description: ID of the file or folder to copy

name.description: Name for the copied item

parentItemId.description: ID of the destination folder for the copy (defaults to same folder if not specified)

siteId.description: ID of the SharePoint site containing the file (used if driveId not provided)

tools.name: get_file_content
tools.description: Retrieve the content of files from SharePoint/OneDrive (Powerpoint, Word, Excel, etc.). Uses driveId if provided, otherwise falls back to siteId.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

getAsXml.description: If true, the content will be returned as XML (for .docx file only). Otherwise, it will be returned as text/html. Must be true if you want to edit the document.

itemId.description: The ID of the file item to retrieve content from.

limit.description: Maximum number of characters to return. Defaults to 32000.

offset.description: Character offset to start reading from (for pagination). Defaults to 0.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

tools.name: search_drive_items
tools.description: Search OneDrive and SharePoint content using Microsoft Graph Search API to find relevant files and documents. This tool returns the results in relevance order.

query.description: Search query to find relevant files and content in OneDrive and SharePoint.

tools.name: search_in_files
tools.description: Search in files in Microsoft OneDrive and SharePoint using Microsoft Copilot retrieval API.

dataSource.description: Specific data source to search in (must be among 'oneDriveBusiness', 'Sharepoint', 'externalItem').

maximumResults.description: Maximum number of results to return (max 25).

query.description: Search query to find relevant files and content.

tools.name: update_word_document
tools.description: Update an existing Word document on OneDrive/SharePoint by providing a new document.xml content. Uses driveId if provided, otherwise falls back to siteId.

documentXml.description: The updated document.xml content to replace in the Word document.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the source file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Word document to update.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the source file. Used if driveId is not provided.

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file from Dust conversation to SharePoint or OneDrive. Supports files up to 250MB using the simple upload API. Uses driveId if provided, otherwise falls back to siteId. Automatically creates folders if they don't exist.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive to upload to. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

fileId.description: The Dust fileId from the conversation attachments to upload.

fileName.description: Optional custom filename for the uploaded file. If not provided, uses the original filename from the attachment.

folderPath.description: Optional path to folder where the file should be uploaded (e.g., 'Documents/Projects'). Folders will be created automatically if they don't exist. If not provided, uploads to the root of the drive.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site to upload to. Used if driveId is not provided.

tools.name: clear_range
tools.description: Clear data from a specific range in an Excel worksheet stored in SharePoint.

applyTo.description: What to clear: 'All' (values and formatting), 'Contents' (values only), 'Formats' (formatting only)

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Excel file to clear the range in.

range.description: Cell range to clear in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1:D10')

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

tools.name: create_worksheet
tools.description: Create a new worksheet (sheet/tab) in an Excel workbook stored in SharePoint.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Excel file to create a worksheet in.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

worksheetName.description: Name for the new worksheet (e.g., 'Q4 Results')

tools.name: get_worksheets
tools.description: Get a list of all worksheets (sheets/tabs) in an Excel workbook stored in SharePoint.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Excel file to get worksheets from.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

tools.name: list_excel_files
tools.description: List Excel files (.xlsx, .xlsm) from SharePoint or OneDrive.

query.description: Search query to find relevant files and content in OneDrive and SharePoint.

tools.name: read_worksheet
tools.description: Read data from a specific range or entire worksheet in an Excel file stored in SharePoint.

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Excel file to read from.

range.description: Optional cell range in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1:D10'). If not provided, reads the used range.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

worksheetName.description: Name of the worksheet to read from (e.g., 'Sheet1')

tools.name: write_worksheet
tools.description: Write data to a specific range in an Excel worksheet stored in SharePoint.

data.description: 2D array of data to write. Each inner array represents a row, and all rows must have the same length. Example: [['Name', 'Age'], ['John', 30], ['Jane', 25]]

driveId.description: The ID of the drive containing the file. Takes priority over siteId if provided.

itemId.description: The ID of the Excel file to write to.

range.description: Target range in A1 notation. Can be either a single cell (e.g., 'A1', 'B5') or a full range (e.g., 'A1:C10'). Data dimensions must match the range size.

siteId.description: The ID of the SharePoint site containing the file. Used if driveId is not provided.

worksheetName.description: Name of the worksheet to write to (e.g., 'Sheet1')

tools.name: list_channels
tools.description: List all channels in a specific team. Returns channel details including name, description, and channel ID. Can be filtered by channel name.

nameFilter.description: Filter channels by name (optional, searches display name).

teamId.description: The ID of the team to list channels from. Use list_teams to get team IDs.

tools.name: list_chats
tools.description: List all chats (one-on-one or group chats) for the authenticated user. Returns chat details including chat ID, topic, and participants. Can be filtered by chat type and chat topic.

chatType.description: Filter chats by type: 'oneOnOne' for direct messages, 'group' for group chats, 'meeting' for meeting chats.

limit.description: Maximum number of chats to return (default: 50, max: 50).

nameFilter.description: Filter chats by topic name (optional, searches chat topic for group chats).

tools.name: list_messages
tools.description: List all messages (and their replies) in a specific channel. Returns thread messages with their replies. Supports pagination to retrieve all results and filtering by date range.

channelId.description: The ID of the channel to list threads from.

fromDate.description: ISO 8601 date string (e.g., '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'). Only retrieve messages modified after this date.

teamId.description: The ID of the team containing the channel.

toDate.description: ISO 8601 date string (e.g., '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z'). Only retrieve messages modified before this date. Defaults to current time.

tools.name: list_teams
tools.description: List all Teams that the authenticated user has joined. Returns team details including name, description, and team ID.

tools.name: list_users
tools.description: List all users in the organization. Returns user details including display name, email, and user ID.

limit.description: Maximum number of users to return (default: 25, max: 25).

nameFilter.description: The name of the user to filter by (optional)

tools.name: post_message
tools.description: Post a message to a Teams channel, chat, or as a reply in a thread. Can send messages to channels, direct chats, or as threaded replies. For direct messages, you can provide userIds instead of chatId to automatically create a chat if it doesn't exist (one-on-one for 1 user, group chat for multiple users). By default (it no chat, channel or users are provided), the message will be sent to the current user's self-chat.

channelId.description: The ID of the channel (required when targetType is 'channel').

chatId.description: The ID of the chat (required when targetType is 'chat', unless userIds is provided).

messageContent.description: The content of the message to post (supports HTML formatting).

parentMessageId.description: The ID of the parent message to reply to (optional, creates a threaded reply). Only supported for channels.

targetType.description: The type of target to post to: 'channel' for team channels, 'chat' for direct/group chats.

teamId.description: The ID of the team (required when targetType is 'channel').

userIds.description: Array of user IDs to send a message to (optional, only for targetType 'chat'). If 1 user ID is provided, a one-on-one chat will be created/used. If multiple user IDs are provided, a group chat will be created. Cannot be used together with chatId.

tools.name: search_messages_content
tools.description: Search for messages contentin Microsoft Teams chats and channels. Returns the results in relevance order.

query.description: Search query to find relevant messages in Teams.

tools.name: placeholder_tool
tools.description: This tool is a placeholder to catch missing actions.

tools.name: create_board
tools.description: Creates a new board in Monday.com

boardName.description: The name of the new board

workspaceId.description: Optional workspace ID to create the board in

tools.name: create_column

itemName.description: The name of the new item

columnValues.description: Optional column values as a JSON object

columnValues.description: Optional column values as a JSON object

itemName.description: The name of the new subitem

tools.description: Adds an update (comment) to a Monday.com item

body.description: The content of the update/comment

itemId.description: The item ID to add the update to

tools.name: delete_group
tools.description: Deletes a group from a Monday.com board

boardId.description: The board ID containing the group

tools.name: delete_item
tools.description: Deletes a Monday.com item

tools.name: duplicate_group
tools.description: Duplicates a group in a Monday.com board

addToTop.description: Whether to add the duplicated group to the top

boardId.description: The board ID containing the group

groupTitle.description: Optional title for the duplicated group

tools.name: find_user_by_name
tools.description: Finds a Monday.com user by name

name.description: The name of the user to find

tools.name: get_activity_logs
tools.description: Retrieves activity logs for a board. Useful for tracking pipeline velocity and user actions.

boardId.description: The board ID to retrieve activity logs for

from.description: Filter logs from this date (ISO 8601 format)

anyOf.description:
The selected agent runs in a background conversation and passes results back to the main agent.
This is the default behavior, well suited for breaking down complex work by delegating specific research/analysis subtasks while maintaining control of the overall response.

The selected agent takes over and responds directly in the conversation.
Well suited for a routing use case where the sub-agent should handle the entire interaction going forward.

tools.name: get_actions
tools.description: Get actions owned by the current user with complete related information for full context. By default, returns only currently due or overdue actions, but can be configured to return all actions. Follows Salesloft best practices: 1. Gets steps (with has_due_actions filter when configured) 2. Gets cadences associated with those steps (complete cadence information) 3. Gets actions for those steps using step_id filter (more efficient than querying all actions) 4. Gets person/contact information for each action (complete contact details) This provides comprehensive context needed to understand and execute each action.

include_due_actions_only.description: Whether to only include actions that are currently due or overdue. Defaults to true.

prompt.description: What the agent should do when the schedule runs. Examples: 'Summarize my emails from yesterday', 'Show PRs that need my review', 'Generate a weekly status report'

If you cannot find the exact channel requested by the user, you MUST ask the user for clarification instead of choosing a different channel.

You MUST ONLY schedule messages to channels or users that were explicitly specified by the user in their request. NEVER schedule messages to alternative channels if the requested channel is not found. If you cannot find the exact channel requested by the user, you MUST ask the user for clarification instead of choosing a different channel.

message.description: The message to post, must follow the Slack message formatting rules. To mention a user, use <@user_id> (use the user's id field, not name). To mention a user group, use <!subteam^user_group_id> (use the user group's id field, not handle).

post_at.description: When to post the message. Can be either: (1) A Unix timestamp in seconds (e.g., 1730380000), or (2) An ISO 8601 datetime string (e.g., '2025-10-31T14:55:00Z' or '2025-10-31T14:55:00+01:00'). The time must be in the future and within 120 days from now.

threadTs.description: The thread ts of the message to reply to. If you need to find the thread ts, you can use the `search_messages` tool, the thread ts is the id of the message you want to reply to. If you don't provide a thread ts, the message will be posted as a top-level message.

to.description: The channel or user to schedule the message to. Accepted values are the channel name, the channel id or the user id. If you need to find the user id, you can use the `list_users` tool. Messages sent to a user will be sent as a direct message.

tools.name: search_channels
tools.description:
Search for Slack channels by ID or name.

AUTOMATIC DETECTION:
- If query is a channel ID (e.g., 'C01234ABCD', 'D01234ABCD'), retrieves that specific channel directly
- If query is text (e.g., 'marketing', 'team-eng'), searches across channel names, topics, and purpose descriptions. Returns top 20 matches.

SCOPE BEHAVIOR (only applies to text searches, ignored for channel IDs):
- 'auto' (default): Searches user's joined channels (public, private, im and mpim) first, then automatically falls back to all public workspace channels if no results found
- 'joined': Searches ONLY in user's joined channels (no fallback)
- 'all': Searches ONLY in all public workspace channels

IMPORTANT: Always use 'auto' scope unless the user explicitly requests a specific scope.

query.description: Channel ID (e.g., 'C01234ABCD'), channel name, or search keywords. Channel IDs are automatically detected.

scope.description: 'auto' (default, always use this unless user specifies), 'joined' (only joined channels), 'all' (only public channels). Ignored when query is a channel ID.

tools.name: search_messages
tools.description: Search messages across public channels, private channels, DMs, and group DMs where the current user is a member

channels.description: Narrow the search to specific channels (optional)

keywords.description: Between 1 and 3 keywords to retrieve relevant messages based on the user request and conversation context.

relativeTimeFrame.description: The time frame (relative to LOCAL_TIME) to restrict the search based on the user request and past conversation context. Possible values are: `all`, `{k}h`, `{k}d`, `{k}w`, `{k}m`, `{k}y` where {k} is a number. Be strict, do not invent invalid values. Also, do not pass this unless the user explicitly asks for some timeframe.

usersFrom.description: Narrow the search to messages wrote by specific users ids (optional)

usersMentioned.description: Narrow the search to messages mentioning specific users ids (optional)

usersTo.description: Narrow the search to direct messages sent to specific user IDs (optional)

tools.name: edit_slideshow_file
tools.description: Modifies content within a slideshow file by substituting specified text segments. Performs single substitution by default, or multiple substitutions when `expected_replacements` is defined. This function demands comprehensive contextual information surrounding the target modification to ensure accurate targeting. Use the retrieve_slideshow_file tool to review the file's existing content prior to executing any text substitution. Requirements: 1. `old_string` MUST contain the precise literal content for substitution (preserving all spacing, formatting, line breaks). 2. `new_string` MUST contain the exact replacement content maintaining proper syntax. 3. Include minimum 3 lines of surrounding context BEFORE and AFTER the target content for unique identification. **Critical:** Multiple matches or inexact matches will cause failure.

expected_replacements.description: Optional number of expected replacements. Defaults to 1. Use when you want to replace multiple identical instances of the same text.

file_id.description: The ID of the slideshow file to update (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

new_string.description: The exact text to replace old_string with. Should maintain proper syntax and follow best practices for the file type.

old_string.description: The exact text to find and replace. Must match the file content exactly, including all spacing, formatting, and line breaks. Include surrounding context to ensure unique identification of the target text.

tools.name: retrieve_slideshow_file
tools.description: Retrieve the current content of an existing slideshow file by its file ID. Use this to read back the content of slideshow files you have previously created or updated. Use this tool before calling edit_slideshow_file to understand the current file state and identify the exact text to replace.

file_id.description: The ID of the slideshow file to retrieve (e.g., 'fil_abc123')

integrationId.description: Filter vulnerabilities by the vulnerability scanner that detected them

isFixAvailable.description: Filter vulnerabilities that have an available fix

packageIdentifier.description: Filter vulnerabilities that are from a specific package

pageCursor.description: Pagination cursor from a previous response

pageSize.description: Maximum number of results per page (1-100), default is 10

slaDeadlineAfterDate.description: Filter vulnerabilities with a fix due after a specific timestamp

slaDeadlineBeforeDate.description: Filter vulnerabilities with a fix due before a specific timestamp

vulnerableAssetId.description: Filter vulnerabilities by a specific asset ID

tools.name: webbrowser
tools.description: A tool to browse websites, you can provide a list of urls to browse all at once.

links.description: If true, also retrieve outgoing links from the page.

tools.name: websearch
tools.description: A tool that performs a Google web search based on a string query.

query.description: The query used to perform the Google search. If requested by the user, use the Google syntax `site:` to restrict the search to a particular website or domain.

tools.name: draft_reply
tools.description: Draft a reply to a Zendesk ticket. Creates a private comment (not visible to the end user) that can be edited before being published. This is useful for preparing responses before making them public.

body.description: The content of the draft reply.

ticketId.description: The ID of the Zendesk ticket to reply to.

tools.name: get_ticket
tools.description: Retrieve a Zendesk ticket by its ID. Returns the ticket details including subject, description, status, priority, assignee, and other metadata. Optionally include ticket metrics such as resolution times, wait times, and reply counts. Optionally include the full conversation with all comments.

includeConversation.description: Whether to include the full conversation (all comments) for the ticket. Defaults to false.

includeMetrics.description: Whether to include ticket metrics (resolution times, wait times, reopens, replies, etc.). Defaults to false.

ticketId.description: The ID of the Zendesk ticket to retrieve.

tools.name: list_ticket_fields
tools.description: Lists ticket field definitions with their ID, title, type, and whether they are active. Includes built-in fields (Subject, Priority, Status) and custom fields. Returns active fields by default. Set includeInactive=true for all fields.

includeInactive.description: Include inactive fields. Defaults to false.

tools.name: search_tickets
tools.description: Search for Zendesk tickets using query syntax. Returns up to 1,000 matching tickets with their details. Supports filtering by status, priority, type, assignee, tags, custom fields, dates, and text fields. Custom fields use syntax: custom_field_{id}:"exact_value". Tags are simple labels; business-specific data are typically stored in custom fields. Use list_ticket_fields to discover available custom field IDs.

query.description: Search query using Zendesk query syntax. Supports field:value pairs for status, priority, type, assignee, tags, and custom_field_{id}:"value" for custom fields. Multiple conditions are combined with AND logic. Do not include 'type:ticket' as it is automatically added.

sortBy.description: Field to sort results by. Defaults to relevance if not specified.

sortOrder.description: Sort order. Defaults to 'desc' if not specified.
